channel.title: UNIX on Viktor Rognås
channel.description: Recent content in UNIX on Viktor Rognås

item.title: Cheat for the command line!
item.description: When you start out using the command line, you will notice that there are many small and handy programs (also referred to as “commands”) you can run. You might start out using pwd (for “print working directory”), which will tell you what directory you are currently in. Then you might use programs such as ls to “list” the contents of a directory, and you might use cd to “change directory” to another directory you might want to go to.
